overview: From 2025-09-10 to 2025-09-11, elizaos/eliza had 8 new PRs (8 merged), 10 new issues, and 9 active contributors.

topPRs.title: feat: Add AI Gateway plugin - Universal access to 100+ AI models
topPRs.author: Dexploarer
topPRs.body:
## Summary
Adds a universal AI Gateway plugin that provides access to 100+ AI models through Vercel AI Gateway and other OpenAI-compatible gateways.

## Features
- ðŸš€ **100+ AI Models** - OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, Meta, Mistral, and more through unified gateways
- ðŸ”„ **Universal Gateway Support** - Works with Vercel AI Gateway, OpenRouter, and any OpenAI-compatible endpoint
- ðŸ’¾ **Response Caching** - Built-in LRU cache for cost optimization
- ðŸ“Š **Built-in Telemetry** - Track usage and performance metrics
- âš¡ **High Performance** - Automatic retry logic and connection pooling
- ðŸŽ¯ **Multiple Actions** - Text generation, image generation, embeddings, and model listing

## Highlights

### Vercel AI Gateway Integration
- Optimized for Vercel's AI Gateway with proper URL format (`https://ai-gateway.vercel.sh/v1`)
- Supports Vercel's colon-based model naming convention (e.g., `openai:gpt-4o`)
- Compatible with Vercel's app attribution headers for analytics

### Flexible Provider Support
- Works with any OpenAI-compatible API endpoint
- Automatic model format detection (colon vs slash separators)
- Seamless switching between providers with minimal configuration

### Enterprise Features
- Response caching with configurable TTL
- Automatic retry logic with exponential backoff
- OIDC authentication support for enterprise deployments
- Comprehensive error handling and fallback mechanisms

## Installation

The plugin is already published to npm for immediate use:
```bash
npm install @promptordie/plugin-aigateway
```

After merge, it will be available as:
```bash
npm install @elizaos/plugin-aigateway
```

## Configuration

```env
# Required
AIGATEWAY_API_KEY=your_api_key_here

# Optional (defaults shown)
AIGATEWAY_BASE_URL=https://ai-gateway.vercel.sh/v1
AIGATEWAY_DEFAULT_MODEL=openai:gpt-4o-mini
AIGATEWAY_LARGE_MODEL=openai:gpt-4o
AIGATEWAY_EMBEDDING_MODEL=openai:text-embedding-3-small
AIGATEWAY_CACHE_TTL=300
AIGATEWAY_MAX_RETRIES=3
```

## Usage

```typescript
import aiGatewayPlugin from '@elizaos/plugin-aigateway';

const character = {
    name: 'MyAgent',
    plugins: [aiGatewayPlugin],
    settings: {
        AIGATEWAY_API_KEY: 'your-api-key'
    }
};
```

## Test Plan
- [x] Built successfully with `bun run build`
- [x] All TypeScript types validated
- [x] Published to npm registry for testing
- [x] Tested with Vercel AI Gateway
- [x] Tested model provider registration
- [ ] Community testing welcomed

## Documentation
Full documentation and examples included in packages/plugin-aigateway/README.md

## Related Links
- NPM Package: https://www.npmjs.com/package/@promptordie/plugin-aigateway
- Vercel AI Gateway Docs: https://vercel.com/docs/ai-gateway

topPRs.title: feat(runs): backend runs tracking (server/core/bootstrap/api-client)
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Runs Tracking Backend Implementation (Server, Core, Bootstrap, API Client)

This PR implements the backend portions of the Runs Tracking and Interface plan described in `docs/runs-tracking-interface.md`. It adds structured logging and server aggregation endpoints enabling the client to render a per-run timeline.

### Context / Problem Statement
- We lacked a consistent way to observe an agent run end-to-end (start, actions, model calls, evaluators, end/timeout).
- Existing logs were unstructured for run-level aggregation, making it hard to build a timeline UI or debug long chains.

### Whatâ€™s Implemented (Non-Frontend)
- Core & Bootstrap logging:
  - Log `RUN_*` lifecycle events as `type: 'run_event'` with `runId`, status, timing, and context.
  - Log `ACTION_STARTED` as `type: 'action_event'` with `runId`, `actionId`, `actionName`, and plan step.
  - Ensure evaluator logs include `body.runId`.
  - Propagate `runId` through embedding generation requests; emit `embedding_event` logs on completion/failure with `runId`.
  - For multi-action plans, include `parentRunId` on action logs for nesting.
- Server API (`packages/server`):
  - New routes under `/api/agents/:agentId/runs`:
    - `GET /runs` â€” lists recent runs with counts and status.
    - `GET /runs/:runId` â€” returns a detailed, chronological timeline for a single run.
  - Efficient aggregation (bulk queries; avoid N+1) and stable response shapes per the plan.
  - Tests added for grouping and timeline shaping.
- API Client (`packages/api-client`):
  - New types: `RunSummary`, `RunDetail`, `RunEvent`, `ListRunsParams`.
  - New service: `runs.listRuns(agentId, params)` and `runs.getRun(agentId, runId, roomId?)`.

### Not Included (Frontend)
- Client hooks and UI (Runs list and Run detail timeline) will follow in a separate PR.

### How to Test
- Run server tests for the runs router; verify grouping, counts, and event shaping.
- Exercise the endpoints manually with Postman or curl:
  - `GET /api/agents/:agentId/runs?roomId=&status=&limit=20`
  - `GET /api/agents/:agentId/runs/:runId?roomId=`

### Notes
- No new DB tables; leverages existing `logs` storage with structured bodies.
- Future: consider JSONB indexes and specialized adapter queries for large datasets.

---

Diff summary:
- docs: add plan doc.
- core/bootstrap: add RUN_* and ACTION_* logging, evaluator runId, embedding runId propagation and events, parentRunId for action plan runs.
- server: new runs router, aggregation logic, and tests.
- api-client: runs types and service.

topPRs.title: feat: Removes Sentry browser SDK from core package
topPRs.author: ChristopherTrimboli
topPRs.body:
Removes the Sentry browser SDK from the core package and includes Sentry node SDK in the server package.

This change avoids bundling browser-incompatible Sentry code in the core package, reducing its size and preventing potential runtime errors in browser environments.

The server package now initializes and uses the Sentry Node SDK, providing server-side error monitoring. Includes a default DSN and leverages API error handling and process-level handlers to capture unhandled exceptions and rejections, enhancing server stability and error tracking.

topPRs.title: fix: only send action notifications for client_chat messages
topPRs.author: tcm390

topPRs.title: feat: Improves client debugging and React version handling
topPRs.author: ChristopherTrimboli
topPRs.body:
Enhances debugging capabilities by enabling sourcemaps and preserving function names for better stack traces.

Ensures a single React instance to prevent version conflicts and related errors.

completedItems.title: feat: Add Sentry Vercel AI integration
completedItems.body: This PR introduces Sentry's Vercel AI integration to improve monitoring and error tracking for deployments on Vercel. It also includes minor code formatting changes.
